trans-unit.source: How to create and publish a product in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to create and publish a product in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and publish products in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and publish products in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to create and publish a product in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to create and publish a product in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: In Azure API Management, a product contains one or more APIs as well as a usage quota and the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: In Azure API Management, a product contains one or more APIs as well as a usage quota and the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: Once a product is published, developers can subscribe to the product and begin to use the product's APIs.
trans-unit.target: Once a product is published, developers can subscribe to the product and begin to use the product's APIs.

trans-unit.source: The topic provides a guide to creating a product, adding an API, and publishing it for developers.
trans-unit.target: The topic provides a guide to creating a product, adding an API, and publishing it for developers.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Create a product
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Create a product

trans-unit.source: Operations are added and configured to an API in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Operations are added and configured to an API in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: To access the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To access the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click on Products in the menu on the left to display the Products page, and click Add Product.
trans-unit.target: Click on Products in the menu on the left to display the Products page, and click Add Product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Products</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Products</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a descriptive name for the product in the Name field and a description of the product in the Description field.
trans-unit.target: Enter a descriptive name for the product in the Name field and a description of the product in the Description field.

trans-unit.source: Products in API Management can be Open or Protected.
trans-unit.target: Products in API Management can be Open or Protected.

trans-unit.source: Protected products must be subscribed to before they can be used, while open products can be used without a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Protected products must be subscribed to before they can be used, while open products can be used without a subscription.

trans-unit.source: Check Require subscription to create a protected product that requires a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Check Require subscription to create a protected product that requires a subscription.

trans-unit.source: This is the default setting.
trans-unit.target: This is the default setting.

trans-unit.source: Check Require subscription approval if you want an administrator to review and accept or reject subscription attempts to this product.
trans-unit.target: Check Require subscription approval if you want an administrator to review and accept or reject subscription attempts to this product.

trans-unit.source: If the box is unchecked, subscription attempts will be auto-approved.
trans-unit.target: If the box is unchecked, subscription attempts will be auto-approved.

trans-unit.source: For more information on subscriptions, see <link><linkText>View subscribers to a product[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on subscriptions, see <link><linkText>View subscribers to a product[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the product, check the Allow multiple subscriptions check box.
trans-unit.target: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the product, check the Allow multiple subscriptions check box.

trans-unit.source: If this box is not checked, each developer account can subscribe only a single time to the product.
trans-unit.target: If this box is not checked, each developer account can subscribe only a single time to the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Unlimited multiple subscriptions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Unlimited multiple subscriptions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To limit the count of multiple simultaneous subscriptions, check the Limit number of simultaneous subscriptions to check box and enter the subscription limit.
trans-unit.target: To limit the count of multiple simultaneous subscriptions, check the Limit number of simultaneous subscriptions to check box and enter the subscription limit.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, simultaneous subscriptions are limited to four per developer account.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, simultaneous subscriptions are limited to four per developer account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Four multiple subscriptions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Four multiple subscriptions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once all new product options are configured, click Save to create the new product.
trans-unit.target: Once all new product options are configured, click Save to create the new product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Products</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Products</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default new products are unpublished, and are visible only to the Administrators group.
trans-unit.target: By default new products are unpublished, and are visible only to the Administrators group.

trans-unit.source: To configure a product, click on the product name in the Products tab.
trans-unit.target: To configure a product, click on the product name in the Products tab.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Add APIs to a product
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Add APIs to a product

trans-unit.source: The Products page contains four links for configuration: Summary, Settings, Visibility, and Subscribers.
trans-unit.target: The Products page contains four links for configuration: Summary, Settings, Visibility, and Subscribers.

trans-unit.source: The Summary tab is where you can add APIs and publish or unpublish a product.
trans-unit.target: The Summary tab is where you can add APIs and publish or unpublish a product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Summary</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Summary</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Before publishing your product you need to add one or more APIs.
trans-unit.target: Before publishing your product you need to add one or more APIs.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click Add API to product.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click Add API to product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add APIs</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add APIs</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the desired APIs and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired APIs and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Add descriptive information to a product
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Add descriptive information to a product

trans-unit.source: The Settings tab allows you to provide detailed information about the product such as its purpose, the APIs it provides access to, and other useful information.
trans-unit.target: The Settings tab allows you to provide detailed information about the product such as its purpose, the APIs it provides access to, and other useful information.

trans-unit.source: The content is targeted at the developers that will be calling the API and can be written in plain text or HTML markup.
trans-unit.target: The content is targeted at the developers that will be calling the API and can be written in plain text or HTML markup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Product settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Product settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Check Require subscription to create a protected product that requires a subscription to be used, or clear the checkbox to create an open product that can be called without a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Check Require subscription to create a protected product that requires a subscription to be used, or clear the checkbox to create an open product that can be called without a subscription.

trans-unit.source: Select Require subscription approval if you want to manually approve all product subscription requests.
trans-unit.target: Select Require subscription approval if you want to manually approve all product subscription requests.

trans-unit.source: By default all product subscriptions are granted automatically.
trans-unit.target: By default all product subscriptions are granted automatically.

trans-unit.source: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the product, check the Allow multiple subscriptions check box and optionally specify a limit.
trans-unit.target: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the product, check the Allow multiple subscriptions check box and optionally specify a limit.

trans-unit.source: If this box is not checked, each developer account can subscribe only a single time to the product.
trans-unit.target: If this box is not checked, each developer account can subscribe only a single time to the product.

trans-unit.source: Optionally fill in the Terms of use field describing the terms of use for the product which subscribers must accept in order to use the product.
trans-unit.target: Optionally fill in the Terms of use field describing the terms of use for the product which subscribers must accept in order to use the product.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Publish a product
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Publish a product

trans-unit.source: Before the APIs in a product can be called, the product must be published.
trans-unit.target: Before the APIs in a product can be called, the product must be published.

trans-unit.source: On the Summary tab for the product, click Publish, and then click Yes, publish it to confirm.
trans-unit.target: On the Summary tab for the product, click Publish, and then click Yes, publish it to confirm.

trans-unit.source: To make a previously published product private, click Unpublish.
trans-unit.target: To make a previously published product private, click Unpublish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Make a product visible to developers
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Make a product visible to developers

trans-unit.source: The Visibility tab allows you to choose which roles are able to see the product on the developer portal and subscribe to the product.
trans-unit.target: The Visibility tab allows you to choose which roles are able to see the product on the developer portal and subscribe to the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Product visibility</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Product visibility</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To enable or disable visibility of a product for the developers in a group, check or uncheck the check box beside the group and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: To enable or disable visibility of a product for the developers in a group, check or uncheck the check box beside the group and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create and use groups to manage developer accounts in Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create and use groups to manage developer accounts in Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>View subscribers to a product
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>View subscribers to a product

trans-unit.source: The Subscribers tab lists the developers who have subscribed to the product.
trans-unit.target: The Subscribers tab lists the developers who have subscribed to the product.

trans-unit.source: The details and settings for each developer can be viewed by clicking on the developer's name.
trans-unit.target: The details and settings for each developer can be viewed by clicking on the developer's name.

trans-unit.source: In this example no developers have yet subscribed to the product.
trans-unit.target: In this example no developers have yet subscribed to the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developers</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developers</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: Once the desired APIs are added and the product published, developers can subscribe to the product and begin to call the APIs.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired APIs are added and the product published, developers can subscribe to the product and begin to call the APIs.

trans-unit.source: For a tutorial that demonstrates these items as well as advanced product configuration see <link><linkText>How create and configure advanced product settings in Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a tutorial that demonstrates these items as well as advanced product configuration see <link><linkText>How create and configure advanced product settings in Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about working with products, see the following video.
trans-unit.target: For more information about working with products, see the following video.
